comments:
If you attempt to import a currently open file the operation warns you that the 
file is open but if you select yes to the overwrite question it allows you to 
step through it and appears to complete even updating the Navigator, however 
then an error message appears and the details say 

?Error opening input stream for <filename>?

If you can not import the open stream no then it should stop the import before 
the user gets to this step.  The whole scenario can be avoided by detecting 
that these files are in use and the user be told to close them before 
attempting to do an import operation.

Please check in latest builds. If you can recreate the case pls show me. From 
reading the steps above I would have expected the import to succeed and the 
editor behavior to mimic the case that the user used some external tool to 
modify the files.

In the latest build attempting to overwrite an open file results in the 
following exception

Log: Thu Jan 17 09:01:01 EST 2002

Cannot replicate the exception using the current code (build >20020115). The 
import now exhibits the same behaviour as editing from an external file - that 
is the user is prompted to see if they want to load changes when the file has 
been overwritten on import.
Closing PR as could not replicate.
